title.narrative: Emergency Response Project in Conflict affected IDP / Returnees in Yirgachefe Woreda ,Gedio Zone, SNNPR

description.narrative:
This project falls under the Pillar 3 covering the construction of transitional shelters and support targeted households with repair and rehabilitation of damaged structures for early recovery of the conflict displaced population.
the 3rd allocation prioritized for transitional or longer-term shelter support in kind or in cash for 10 % prioritized affected households, thus 29,000 under Pillar 3 to cover Gedeo – West Guji conflict IDPs/ returnees that will be supported through construction of temporary shelter where their original homes have been destroyed, or where families are temporally settling location.
In line with this strategy CARE Ethiopia will work on the provision of one-off cash and vouchers to 1000 households. The value of delivered cash or vouchers is based on the SNFI cluster or CWG MEB for Gedeo- West Guji. Based on the shelter cluster assessment that was done on August, 2018 as well as the local government recommendation on the list of shelter constructions materials needed, CARE Ethiopia has calculated the transfer value which is 336 USD per household considering the local market price for the items included in the calculation. The shelter materials comprise to nails, Corrugated galvanized Iron sheet (Iron Sheet G-35 CGI) and skilled labor. The skilled labor cost is calculated for five days with 5.47 USD per day.
Given the targeting and protection concern that was raised in Bole Hora NDRMC- lead EOC temporarily suspend cash based humanitarian intervention in both West Guji and Gedeo. Thus CARE will follow up the recommended mitigation measure circulated by the CWG to minimize the targeting and protection concerns. If the concerns continues to exist and the suspension in cash response not uplifted, CARE will consider the third option which is proving the shelter items in kind and facilitate construction
In Gedeo, CARE will work in close coordination with Save the Children and World Vision, and/or any other active actor providing or planning to provide cash assistance, to make sure the most vulnerable HHs are being targeted and that there are synergies in the proposed implementation modalities as well as that there is no duplication.
CARE Ethiopia is a member of CWG and SNFI cluster at national and regional level and well known for having a presence in the country as well as in Gedeo zone by providing humanitarian assistance to IDPs and disaster affected communities.
Total targeted population of the action are to 6000 individual (1000HHs). The project duration will be 6 months with a total cost of $436,426
